The photometry module¶

fadra.photometry module¶

class fadra.photometry.Photometry(sci, aperture=None, sky=None, mdark=None, mflat=None, calculate_stamps=True, target_coords=None, stamp_rad=None, new_coords=None, stamp_coords=None, epoch=None, labels=None, deg=1, gain=None, ron=None)¶

Bases: dataproc.timeseries.Photometry.TimeseriesExamine

CPUphot()¶

Performs aperture photometry on the CPU.

Returns:TimeSeries with the resulting photometry
Return type:TimeSeries
GPUphot()¶

Performs aperture photometry on the GPU.

Returns:TimeSeries with the resulting photometry
Return type:TimeSeries
centroid(orig_arr, medsub=True)¶

Find centroid of small array

Parameters:orig_arr (SciPy array) – array
Returns:coordinates of the centroid of orig_array
Return type:[float, float]
get_stamps(sci, target_coords, stamp_rad)¶

Get stamps from an AstroDir of astronomical images, to perform aperture photometry.

Parameters:
  • sci (AstroDir) – Raw astronomical images
  • target_coords ([[t1x, t1y], [t2x, t2y], ...]) – Coordinates for all the stars over which photometry is to be performed, in coordinates of the first raw image
  • stamp_rad (int) – “Square radius” for the stamps. Each stamp will be of shape (2*stamp_rad, 2*stamp_rad)
Returns:

N data cubes of M stamps each. N is the number of targets, M the number of raw images.

Also: coordinates of the centroid of each stamp in image coordinates and in stamp coordinates, list of epochs for each image, and target labels.

photometry(aperture=None, sky=None, gpu=False)¶

Peforms aperture photometry by calling the CPU or GPU photometry according to the given flag.

Parameters:
  • aperture (int) – Aperture radius for photometry
  • sky ([int, int] or polynomial fit for sky annulus) – Inner and outer radii for sky annulus
  • gpu – gpu=False (default) runs CPU photometry. True runs GPU photometry.
Returns:

TimeSeries with the performed photometry
Return type:

TimeSeries
plot_radialprofile(targets=None, xlim=None, axes=1, legend_size=None, **kwargs)¶

Plot Radial Profile from data using radialprofile() function

Parameters:target (integer, string or 2-element list) – Target spoecification for recentering. Either an integer for specifc target, or a 2-element list for x/y coordinates.
radialprofile(target, stamprad=None, frame=0, recenter=False)¶

Returns the x and y arrays for radial profile

Parameters:
  • target (integer/string or 2-element list) – Target spoecification for recentering. Either an integer for specifc target, or a 2-element list for x/y coordinates.
  • frame (integer) – which frame to show
  • recenter (bool) – whether to recenter
Return type:

(x-array, y-array, [x,y] center)
showstamp(target=None, stamprad=30, first=0, last=-1, figure=None, ncol=None)¶

Show the star at the same position for the different frames

Parameters:
  • target – None for the first key()
  • stamprad – Plotting radius
  • first – First frame to show
  • last – Last frame to show. It can be on Python negative format
  • figure – Specify figure number
  • ncol – Number of columns
